text: finally this is the first shipment of
aid heading into the city of Tacloban
it's almost a week after typhoon Haiyan
struck and for the people living here
who are homeless and needy it can't
arrive here soon enough
well we're on board now and they're
beginning to unload in the rain
here we've got quite a lot of food in
these sacks here there's enough
apparently for five families to last
three days we've also got boxes of what
looks like noodles and a lot of water
here a lot of people in town saying
water is the one thing that they really
need now the back of the ship you can
see we've got a Red Cross vehicle there
what looks like an ambulance some
military and there's also quite a lot of
rice that they're wanting to bring into
town that's one of the big staple foods
here so the first aid is arriving but to
be honest given the scale of the
situation in Tacloban it's not that much
stuff they're going to need much more
than this and while we've got aid coming
in to Tacloban over there there are
thousands of people trying to get out of
the city
so many of them have lost their homes
this ship here is going to evacuate a
thousand people from Tacloban these
people have packed up their bags
whatever they've still got left many of
them will have lost their homes and
these are the ones who are lucky enough
to have got a ticket at the gates of the
port it's a different story
these people are all desperate to get on
board that ship but they don't have a
ticket and the one thing we've heard
constantly over the last few days and
we're hearing it here is there's no food
and there's no water in Tacloban and
that's why they're wanting to get out
there are also rumors that things are
becoming more violent that people are
beginning to attack each other for food
houses are being burgled now at the
moment those sort of things are rumors
but when people are desperate like this
such rumors can spread quickly the aid
is now coming in it's beginning to
arrive what's needed is to get it out to
the people
